intro: Cacalia acaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are leafless, giving it the common name "naked-stemmed," and it produces small, blue to purple flowers in the summer. Cacalia acaulis is often found in clusters and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
